footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.93:1)
a) Narrated Ibn Abî Lailâ: Only Umm Hânî told us that she had seen the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم offering the Duha (Forenoon prayer). She said. "On the day of the conquest of Makkah, the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم took a bath in my house and offered eight Raka‘ât. I never saw him praying such a light prayer but he performed perfect prostrations and bowings". (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.2, Hadith No.207A).
b) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه : My friend (the Prophet) advised me to observe three things:
(1) to fast three days a month;
(2) to pray two Raka‘ât of Duha prayer (Forenoon prayer); and
(3) to pray Witr before sleeping. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.3, Hadith No.202).

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,[1941]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the night when it darkens (and stand still).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the night when it is still,

phonetic: 93.3 Mā Wadda`aka Rabbuka Wa Mā Qalá

translations.english_saheeh: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muḥammad], nor has He detested [you].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Your Lord (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has neither forsaken you nor hates you.
translations.english_rwwad: your Lord has not forsaken you [O Prophet], nor does He hate you;

phonetic: 93.4 Wa Lal'ākhiratu Khayrun Laka Mina Al-'Ūlá

translations.english_saheeh: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed the Hereafter is better for you than the present (life of this world).
translations.english_rwwad: the Hereafter is better for you than the present life;

translations.english_saheeh: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, your Lord will give you (all good) so that you shall be well-pleased.
translations.english_rwwad: and your Lord will certainly give you so much that you will be well pleased.

translations.english_saheeh: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Did He not find you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) an orphan and gave you a refuge?
translations.english_rwwad: Did He not find you an orphan then take good care of you?

translations.english_saheeh: And He found you lost and guided [you],
translations.english_hilali_khan: And He found you unaware (of the Qur’ân, its laws, and Prophethood) and guided you?
translations.english_rwwad: Did He not find you unguided then guide you?

translations.english_saheeh: And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And He found you poor and made you rich (self-sufficient with self-contentment)?
translations.english_rwwad: Did He not find you in need then enrich you?

translations.english_saheeh: So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore, treat not the orphan with oppression.
translations.english_rwwad: So do not mistreat the orphan,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1942]- Anyone who seeks aid or knowledge.

translations.english_saheeh: And as for the petitioner,[1942] do not repel [him].
But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And proclaim the Grace of your Lord (i.e. the Prophethood and all other Graces).
translations.english_rwwad: and proclaim the blessings of your Lord.
